intro: Mineirella eriophora, commonly known as the slender thornplant, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. It produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in a cylindrical shape, and its leaves are narrow and often covered in fine hairs. Due to its hardy nature, it is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant in dry gardens.
